titleStmt.title: Letter from Mary B. Talbert to Eartha M. M. White, July 25, 1922
titleStmt.author: Mary B. Talbert

respStmt.name: Bryan Morris and Carol Lynne Hemmingway

msContents.summary: Author writes to White describing the organization of the Anti-Lynching Crusaders and White's duties as Florida state director.

body.p:
In my previous letter to you, it was not possible for me to give you in
detail the work of this Associationassociation, known as the Anti-Lynching Crusaders, of
which I am glad to consider you a part.

The object of this Associationassociation shall be to unite a million American
women to stop lynching. The crusading is to be conducted thru prayer; and
while we have designated the month of August as our month of organization,
the month of September for instruction, our intensive campaign work will
begin the first Sunday morning in October with sunrise prayer meeting, at
which time, we hope over a million women will unite in prayer to God
for the stopping of this,- the greatest crime in America.

Believing that the greater number of Statestate Directorsdirectors will be assembled
at Richmond, than any other place during the Summersummer, I shall call a meeting of
the Statestate Directorsdirectors either August 10th or 11th--, the time to be announced while
at the Conventionconvention.

Miss Mary E. Jackson will be the Nationalnational Organizerorganizer, and as Organizerorganizer,
will be available to help in your particular section. If the work is too stren
uous, we will place in the field, other organizers to assist Miss Jackson.

It is the aim of this Committeecommittee to start on the Campaigncampaign, with every women
talking and praying for the same thing, and, in order to do this effectively, a
letter of instruction will be issued the first week in September.

As Statestate Directordirector, the important thing for you to do now, is to appoint
a Keykey Womanwoman in every city and town in your state. This Keykey Womanwoman, in turn, will
gather about her, her committee, who will do intensive work during this Campaigncampaign.

Anti-Lynching Campaign buttons will be furnished, which will be the
emblem worn by every crusader, during this Drivedrive. These buttons will be
furnished to you at cost, and you in turn will sell them at 10 cents each.

Let it be understood, that the expense necessary to carry on this crusade
will be raised by a separate expense fund, for we have decided, that no part of
this sacrifice or self denial fund shall be used for any thing except for the
purpose for which it has been raised.

We will expect you as Statestate Directordirector, to cover your territory, and at
Richmond, we will decide how your expense will be taken care of, as well as
postage, stationary, and other things necessary to care on this Campaigncampaign.

I have not attempted to give a full and perfect letter of instructions,
but simply thoughts for you to think about, and which we will discuss at
Richmond.

closer.salute:
Yours for the Greatestgreatest Movementmovement that has ever swept
America, embracing both white women and black women,
